triples.name: Natural selection
triples.relevance: Core evolutionary mechanism that Bonner uses to explain progressive increase in complexity.

triples.name: Evolution
triples.relevance: Central subject of the book examining how complexity evolves over time.

triples.name: Biological life cycle
triples.relevance: Novel framework proposed by Bonner as key to understanding evolutionary change and complexity.

triples.name: Cellular differentiation
triples.relevance: Used to explain internal complexity within organisms and its relationship to evolutionary development.

triples.name: Genetics
triples.relevance: Knowledge domain combined with development, ecology, and behavior to understand evolution.

triples.name: Ecology
triples.relevance: Used to analyze external complexity within ecological communities and evolutionary ecosystems.
